Detailed Description

Base class for all lights.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzLight::ShadowType

The type of shadowing to use for the light.

Enumerator:
None 

The light does not utilize shadows

DeepShadowMap 

The light utilizes a Deep Shadow Map (DSM)

Raytraced 

The light utilizes ray-traced shadows

virtual void DzLight::aimAt ( const DzVec3 &  pos  )  [inline, virtual]

Rotates the camera and adjusts its focal distance so that its focal point is at the given point.

Parameters:
pos The point to aim the camera at.

Implements DzCamera.

Reimplemented in DzDistantLight, and DzSpotLight.

true if it is possible to view through this light.

const QString &  shadowMap 
) const [pure virtual]

Called by the (off-line) renderer to create the light in the scene.

Parameters:
settings The render settings in use.
shadowMap Contains the name of the shadow map to use, or none if it is empty

void DzLight::draw ( const DzDrawStyle &  style  )  const [virtual]

Draws a representation of the light in the interactive viewport. The Default implementation just draws a bounding box when selected.

Parameters:
style The drawing style for the render.

Reimplemented from DzCamera.

Reimplemented in DzDistantLight, DzLinearPointLight, DzPointLight, and DzSpotLight.

virtual void DzLight::frame ( const DzBox3 &  box,
float  aspect 
) [inline, virtual]

Translates the camera so that its view frames the given box, and sets the camera's focal point to the center of the box, given the aspect ratio of the current view (w / h)

Parameters:
box The bounding box to frame in the camera's view
aspect The aspect ratio of the current view.

Implements DzCamera.

Reimplemented in DzDistantLight, and DzSpotLight.

Returns:

DzVec3 DzLight::getWSDirection (  )  const [virtual, slot]

Calculates the direction that light is being cast from this light.

Only valid for directional light sources.

Returns:
The current world-space light-casting direction vector.

Reimplemented in DzDistantLight.

bool DzLight::isAreaLight (  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if this is an area light source. If true, the light source center will be given by the position of the light. Additional light geometry will be defined in the derived classes.
bool DzLight::isDirectional (  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]

Indicates if this light is an infinite directional light.

Directional lights do not have a position per se. They are assumed to lie at infinity and cast parallel rays of light into the scene.

Returns:
true if this light is directional. False for omni-directional lights.

Reimplemented in DzPointLight, and DzSpotLight.

bool DzLight::isOn (  )  const [pure virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if this light is currently on.

Implemented in DzDistantLight.

void DzLight::setGLLight ( const DzDrawStyle &  style,
int  pass = 0,
int  totalPasses = 1,
bool  useIndexZero = false 
)

Called by the framework when the light needs to set the OpenGL state before drawing geometry in the view. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
style The current draw style
pass If the light is an area light and needs to be jittered during a multi-pass render, this is the index of the current pass.
totalPasses For area lights, this is the total number of jitter passes that will be used to render the light.
useIndexZero If true, the light is forced to use index zero - this is used for rendering one light at a time in hardware-assisted renders.
void DzLight::setGLLighting ( const DzDrawStyle &  style,
int  pass = 0,
int  totalPasses = 1 
) [protected, pure virtual]

Derived classes should override this method in order to set up OpenGL for their light.

Parameters:
style The draw style for the drawing operation.
pass The current rendering pass
totalPasses The total number of rendering passes for the drawing operation.

Implemented in DzDistantLight, DzLinearPointLight, DzPointLight, and DzSpotLight.

void DzLight::setGLShadow ( int  pass,
int  totalPasses,
int *  shadowMapSize = NULL 
) [pure virtual]

Called by the OpenGL renderer to create the perspective of the light needed to render a shadow map. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
pass If the light is an area light and needs to be jittered during a multi-pass render, this is the index of the current pass.
totalPasses For area lights, this is the total number of jitter passes that will be
shadowMapSize A pointer to an integer that will be set to the size of the shadowmap that is generated by this light.

Implemented in DzDistantLight, and DzPointLight.

void DzLight::setShadowTransform ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings,
const DzCamera *  camera 
) const [pure virtual]

Called by the (off-line) renderer to create the perspective of the light needed to render a deep shadow map.

Parameters:
settings The render settings in use.
camera The camera that will be used for the final render of the view

void DzLight::unsetGLLight ( const DzDrawStyle &  style  ) 

Called by the framework when the light needs to unset the OpenGL state after drawing geometry in the view. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
style The current draw style
void DzLight::unsetGLLighting ( const DzDrawStyle &  style  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Derived classes should override this method in order to undo any state changes that were made in set

Parameters:
style The drawstyle for the rendering operation that this light was last used in.

Implemented in DzDistantLight, DzLinearPointLight, DzPointLight, and DzSpotLight.

void DzLight::unsetGLShadow (  )  [pure virtual]

Undo OpenGL state changes made during setGLShadow(). Called by the OpenGL renderer to allow the light to undo OGL state changes that it made and to store any shadow map that may have been generated during the drawing process. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Implemented in DzDistantLight, and DzPointLight.
